DOC.brief_summary: This randomized phase II trial evaluate low-fat diet fish oil potential delay disease progression patient prostate cancer undergo active surveillance .
DOC.brief_title: Low-Fat Diet Fish Oil Men Active Surveillance Prostate Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine 1-year low-fat fish oil ( omega-3 fatty acid ) intervention result decrease prostate cancer proliferation compare control group men active surveillance . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To evaluate effect low-fat ( LF ) /fish oil ( FO ) intervention prostate biopsy tissue marker proliferation cell cycle progression , prostate biopsy pathologic feature ( Gleason grade , percent core cancer , percent tissue cancer ) , prostate-specific antigen ( PSA ) , long-term clinical outcome ( clinical progression , prostate cancer therapy ) . II . To evaluate potential surrogate biomarkers proliferation ( red blood cell [ RBC ] membrane fatty acid analysis , ex-vivo bioassay ) . III . To determine correlation exists free fatty acid receptor 4 ( GPR120 ) level antiproliferative response LF/FO intervention . IV . To evaluate compliance 1-year LF/FO intervention . V. To evaluate safety 1-year LF/FO intervention . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I : Patients receive intervention . ARM II : Patients receive dietary counseling research dietitian weekly 1 month monthly 11 month . Patients give guideline recommend meal follow low-fat diet comprise 20 % kilocalorie ( Kcal ) fat , 15 % Kcal protein , 65 % Kcal carbohydrates 1 year . Patients also receive 4 fish oil capsule per day orally ( PO ) 1 year . After completion study , patient follow yearly 15 year .
DOC.criteria: Patients sign inform consent Patient prostate biopsy perform Dr. Mark Artemis device adenocarcinoma prostate Patient elect undergo active surveillance Clinical stage T2c le Gleason grade 3+4 less PSA < 20 Geographically able study visit University California , Los Angeles ( UCLA ) Clinical Research Unit Subjects willing consume lycopene , green tea pomegranate supplement pomegranate juice 1year study If subject randomize control group agree consume fish oil capsule 1year study Diagnostic prostate biopsy 1 core cancer < 5 % tissue core involved cancer Patient take finasteride dutasteride prior year Patient take fish oil prior 3 month Patient prior treatment prostate cancer ( surgery , radiation , local ablative therapy , antiandrogen therapy androgen deprivation therapy ) Patient medical condition exclude undergoing repeat prostate biopsy 1year Patient allergy fish
